5- AVG identifies Activator v3.1.exe as a possible threat:

The  av scan results of Norton, Kaspersky, Avast, NOD32 and AVG 
are all false positives, caused by some used binaries and cryptors.

Also scanned with some well known antispyware, and tested in Sandboxie.
Malware detected by other anti-malware software probably are false positives!

So just stay cool ... or don't use this!!!

worked.took many attempts.instructions in assitant file.(fake trojan)no real viruses here.put exception in ur antivirus.run as adminstrator.i ran in safe mode to do this.suggest read assitant file first before setup.also this software comes with its own antivirus and asks you to uninstall yours or it wont install theirs.i uninstalled avg,and system mechanic antivirus wouldnt install anyway.wierd.anyway,tried license# supplied in assistant and 5 fails in a row.so i installed trial.then messed with assistant putting check marks on everything possible.reset license. tried another serial with my personal email and worked right away...while connected to internet. =D  if you cant get past trial, keep trying assistant. p.s serial maker says version8 but worked for this.ver 10.1.2 thanks anacondaz

Great upload! Thanks for sharing!
